name: empathy_contagion
prompt: A contagious condition makes people physically feel the pain of others. Write the diary of a doctor in the first hospital to collapse because of it.
decoded:
Dear Diary,

Today, I was called to the hospital to treat a patient who was suffering from a severe headache. As soon as I entered the room, I felt a sharp pain in my head. I tried to ignore it, but it only got worse. I couldn't stop it, and I felt like I was going to collapse.

I tried to lie down, but it didn't help. I couldn't stop the pain, and I felt like I was going to pass out. I couldn't believe this was happening to me. I was supposed to be a doctor, and I was supposed to be able to help my patients.

I tried to call for help, but I was too weak to speak. I couldn't believe this was happening to me. I was supposed to be a doctor, and I was supposed to be able to help my patients.

I couldn't believe this was happening to me. I was supposed to be a doctor, and I was supposed to be able to help my patients.

I couldn't believe this was happening to me. I was supposed to be a doctor, and I was supposed to be able to help my patients.

Dear Diary,

[Your Name]
